sense.name: flow in an irregular current with a burbling noise
sense.examples: The brook bubbled over the stones. The water bubbled through the filtration system of the fish tank. Colored liquids will bubble through the pathways once they're set up. The water in the fountain bubbled unpredictably. The pasta bubbled around in the pot.

sense.name: emit bubbles, effervesce
sense.examples: Soup was bubbling in a pot over the fire. The water for tea bubbled on the stove. The soda bubbled in the cup, quickly going flat. The many chemicals of the mad scientist quietly bubbled in beakers. Baking soda and vinegar bubble on contact.

sense.name: cause to form bubbles
sense.examples: A chemical reaction bubbled the liquid. Surface tension allowed the children to bubble the soap. Scientists bubble gas through liquids in their experiments. Children bubble soap in water by splashing in their baths. For my next trick, I will bubble this gas through this liquid.

sense.name: be excited, joyful
sense.examples: The play bubbled with song and dance. The young girl bubbled on her first date. Max bubbled all day after acing his math text. The football players will bubble for days if they win. Jenine is still bubbling from her promotion.
